operations.notes:
Use the GET method on this endpoint to retrieve router_alerts records. Use the available filtering fields to narrow or broaden your search.

Note: There is a 100 device limit for API queries. If you attempt to retrieve records for more than 100 devices in a single query you will receive an error message. If you do not explicitly specify devices, it is assumed that you are trying to pull records for all devices in your account. If you have more than 100 devices in your account then you may query in batches. See the example titled 'Net Device Usage and Signal Samples' on the Sample Code page for details on querying in batches.

parameters.name: router__in
parameters.description: Filter for router ID contains - a comma-separated list of router-record IDs

parameters.name: created_at
parameters.description: Timestamp for when the router_alerts record was created

parameters.name: created_at__lt
parameters.description: Less than filtering operator for created_at

parameters.name: created_at__gt
parameters.description: Filter for created_at is greater than

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid
parameters.description: A unique ID (timeuuid) associated with the created_at timestamp

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__in
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid in - a comma-separated list of timeuuids for router_alerts records

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__gt
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid is greater than

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__gte
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid is greater than or equal to

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__lt
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid is less than

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__lte
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid is less than or equal

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Specifies the sort order for response data

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restricts the number of records returned in a recordset to this value. Max value is 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specifies where (an index) in a recordset to begin returning records.

operations.notes:
Use the GET method on this endpoint to retrieve router_logs records. Use the available filtering fields to narrow or broaden your search.

Note: To receive router logs, you must enable them on the Groups page in NCM using the Settings dialog and selecting the Enable Log Reporting option. Enabling device logs can significantly increase the NCM network traffic from the device to the server depending on how quickly the device is generating log events.

parameters.description: ID of the Router to retrieve logs from

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__gte
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid is greater than or equal to

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__lt
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid is less than

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__lte
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid is less than or equal

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Specifies the sort order for response data

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restricts the number of records returned in a recordset to this value. Max value is 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specifies where (an index) in a recordset to begin returning records.

operations.notes: Use the GET method on this endpoint to retrieve historical_locations records. Use the available filtering fields to narrow or broaden your search.
operations.description: Use the GET method on this endpoint to retrieve historical_locations records. Use the available filtering fields to narrow or broaden your search

parameters.name: router
parameters.description: The ID of the router that sent the location data. This parameter is REQUIRED. Only one router ID may be specified per query; you can't provide a list of router IDs to this endpoint.

parameters.name: created_at__gt
parameters.description: Return only data points with created_at timestamps AFTER this datetime. If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed.

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__gt
parameters.description: Return only data points with created_at_timeuuid values AFTER this UUID. Using this query parameter causes the query to skip older data points which were recorded before the created_at_timeuuid field was added. A unique ID associated with the created_at timestamp

parameters.name: created_at__lte
parameters.description: Return only data points with created_at timestamps ON OR BEFORE this. If limit is reached first then this parameter does not apply.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Return no more than this many location data points. If created_at__lte is reached first then this parameter does not apply.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restricts the number of records returned in a recordset to this value. Max value is 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specifies where (an index) in a recordset to begin returning records.

parameters.description: Specifies where (an index) in a recordset to begin returning records.

operations.notes:
This operation reboots a router or a group. Add a JSON object to the 'Content' field containing a router field or group field to specify the reboot action applies to a specific router or to a group of routers. For example:

{"router":"/api/v2/routers/<router ID>/"} or {"group":"/api/v2/groups/<group ID>/"}

parameters.description: JSON object representing either the router or group to reboot

operations.notes:
Make GET requests to return a list of your accounts and information about them.

This endpoint can be called without parameters to retrieve all of your accounts/subaccounts, or filtered by a specific account number, ID, or name. These filters also support lists of account numbers, record IDs, or names using the __in filter. When using the __in filter, supply a list of comma-separated values to return only the products with attributes matching those values.

Example URL

 https://www.cradlepointecm.com/api/v2/accounts/?id=1127&name=cradlepoint

parameters.name: account__in
parameters.description: Filter for account contains - a comma-separated list of account IDs

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Object ID of an accounts record

parameters.name: id__in
parameters.description: Filter for ID contains - a comma-separated list of account record IDs

parameters.name: name__in
parameters.description: Filter for name contains - a comma-separated list of account names.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Specifies that the returned value for the passed in attribute be expanded in the response body.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restricts the number of records returned in a recordset to this value. Max value is 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specifies where (an index) in a recordset to begin returning records.

operations.notes: Make PUT requests to the accounts endpoint to update a sub-account's name value.
operations.description: This operation updates an account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the account to PUT

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: JSON object in the form {'name':'<a name for the subaccount>'}.

operations.notes: Make POST requests to the accounts endpoint to create new sub-accounts.
operations.description: POST operations to the accounts endpoint creates new sub-accounts.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: JSON object in the form {'name':'<a name for the subaccount>'}.

operations.notes:
Make DELETE requests to delete accounts with the matching id.

Note: The 'Try it out' button is removed for this example since the delete process is not reversible. Once a delete occurs the data is gone forever.
operations.description: This operation deletes an account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the accounts record to delete

operations.notes: Use the DELETE method on this endpoint to delete a routers record. This method requires the ID of the routers record to delete. Performing a DELETE action removes the record from NetCloud and can't be reversed.
operations.description: This method deletes device information with associated id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of router record to delete

operations.notes:
Use the GET method on this endpoint to retrieve router_state_samples records. Use the available filtering fields to narrow or broaden your search. This endpoint provides information about the connection state of a device with NetCloud servers.

Note: There is a 100 device limit for API queries. If you attempt to retrieve records for more than 100 devices in a single query you will receive an error message. If you do not explicitly specify devices, it is assumed that you are trying to pull records for all devices in your account. If you have more than 100 devices in your account then you may query in batches. See the example titled 'Net Device Usage and Signal Samples' on the Sample Code page for details on querying net_device_signal_samples in batches.

parameters.name: router__in
parameters.description: Filter for router ID contains - a comma-separated list of router-record IDs

parameters.name: created_at
parameters.description: Timestamp for when the router_state_samples record was created

parameters.name: created_at__lt
parameters.description: Less than filtering operator for created_at

parameters.name: created_at__gt
parameters.description: Filter for created_at is greater than

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid
parameters.description: A unique ID (timeuuid) associated with the created_at timestamp

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__in
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid in - a comma-separated list of timeuuids for router_state_samples records

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__gt
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid is greater than

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__gte
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid is greater than or equal to

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__lt
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid is less than

parameters.name: created_at_timeuuid__lte
parameters.description: Filter for created_at_timeuuid is less than or equal

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Specifies the sort order for response data

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restricts the number of records returned in a recordset to this value. Max value is 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specifies where (an index) in a recordset to begin returning records.

operations.notes: Use the POST method on this endpoint to create a new test_alert_push_destinations record. Include the fields/values to add for the record in the 'Content' field as a JSON object. This requires only the destination_config_id of the alert_push_destination to test.
operations.description: Use the POST method on this endpoint to create a new test_alert_push_destinations record. Include the fields/values to add for the record in the 'Content' field as a JSON object. This requires only the destination_config_id of the alert_push_destination to test.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: JSON containing the destination_config_id of the alert_push_destination to test

operations.notes:
Gets the results of a speed test job. The results are updated with the latest known state of the speed tests.

Example URL

 https://www.cradlepointecm.com/api/v2/speed_test/{id}/

operations.summary: Creates a new speed test job
operations.notes: Creates a speed test job that queues/runs speed tests for a given list of network devices.
operations.description: Used to create and queue a speed test job. Once started the speed test job will queue as many individual speed tests as the system allows. When a speed test finishes more speed tests are started. This repeats until all the speed tests have completed.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Add  the JSON that defines the speed test

operations.notes:
Deletes a speed test job. Deleting a job aborts it, but any test already started on a router will finish.

Note: The 'Try it out' button is removed for this example since the delete process is not reversible. Once a delete occurs the data is gone forever.
operations.description: Deletes a speed test job.
